original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares down in mid day trade
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares were down during mid day trade on Monday.
As per an analyst the market started off on a positive trend, with a retail favorites witnessing buying interest that gradually diverted into selling pressures.
“Selling pressure is seen in the LOLC counter, as it was a top contributor and was gaining in trade and eventually turned to selling pressures,” the analyst said.
All Share Price Index was down 0.32 percent or 29.62 points to 9,271.47, while the most liquid index S&P SL20 was up 0.17 percent or 4.59 points to 2,687.42.
Banks are losing on selling pressures and volatile emotions on the index. As banks hold the biggest share in the stock market it is dragging the index down. (Colombo/Apr/2023)
